name: Persepolis
description: Persepolis was the ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire. The monumental staircases, reliefs, and columns reflect the power and artistry of ancient Persia.

name: Pasargadae
description: Pasargadae is the site of the tomb of Cyrus the Great and the remains of his capital city. It marks the birth of the Persian Empire and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Naqsh-e Rostam
description: Naqsh-e Rostam contains rock-cut tombs of Achaemenid kings and Sassanian reliefs that depict royal ceremonies, battles, and religious symbolism.
